data.title: Valdés Peninsula
data.text: The Valdes Peninsula (Spanish: "Pennsula Valds") is a peninsula into the Atlantic Ocean in the Biedma Department of north-east Chubut Province, Argentina. Around in size (not taking into account the isthmus of Carlos Ameghino which connects the peninsula to the mainland), it is an important nature reserve which was listed as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1999.Geography.The nearest large town is Puerto Madryn. The only town on the peninsula is the small settlement of Puerto Pirmides. There are also a number of "estancias", where sheep are raised.
